item.title: Why You May Want to Cheer for Money-Market Funds
item.description: Money funds remain an attractive place for excess cash, and can help keep a lid on short-term borrowing costs.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Trade Mixed
item.description: U.S. stocks were mixed as investors were considering a deal, signed into law by President Biden on Saturday, to avoid a government shutdown.

item.title: Treasury Yields Rise Ahead of Consumer Sentiment Data
item.description: Treasury yields extended post-Fed gains following the passage of a stopgap spending bill to avert a U.S. government shutdown.

item.title: Xerox to Buy Printer Maker Lexmark From Chinese Owners
item.description: The deal values closely held Lexmark at $1.5 billion, including debt.

item.title: They Thought They Were Nearly Done With Student Loans, but Then Came Trump
item.description: A signature piece of the Biden administrationâ€™s effort to reduce the $1.6 trillion student-loan burden is now in limbo, hitting public-service workers...
